title: System and method for communicating using a multiserver platform
abstract: Aspects of the invention include receiving a first packet from a first of a plurality of blade servers at a first data rate and determining a second blade server that may receive the first packet. Data responsive to the received first packet may be transferred to the second blade server at a negotiated first data rate. A second packet comprising at least a portion of the first received packet may be transferred to the second blade server at the negotiated data rate. At least a portion of the first received packet may be transferred to at least the second blade server via a common bus. In another aspect of the invention, at least a third packet may be received from a network at a second data rate. Data responsive to the third packet may be transferred to at least a third blade server at a newly negotiated data rate.

motivations: There is a need for efficient communication between multiple servers in a multiserver platform.
Existing systems may not be able to handle varying data rates and packet transfers between servers effectively.
objectives: Develop a system and method for communicating between multiple blade servers in a multiserver platform.
Enable efficient transfer of data between servers at negotiated data rates.
methods: Receive and process packets from multiple blade servers at varying data rates.
Negotiate data rates for transferring data between servers.
Utilize a common bus to transfer data between servers.
results: Improved communication efficiency between multiple servers in a multiserver platform.
Enhanced ability to handle varying data rates and packet transfers between servers.
llama_json.research_subject: Multiserver platform communication system and method

motivations: There is a need for efficient communication between multiple blade servers at varying data rates.
Existing systems may not effectively negotiate data rates for transferring packets between servers.
objectives: Receive and determine the appropriate blade server for packet transfer at a first data rate.
Transfer data responsive to the received packet to the determined blade server at a negotiated data rate.
Receive a packet from a network at a second data rate and transfer data responsive to this packet to a blade server at a newly negotiated data rate.
methods: Receive a packet from a blade server and determine another blade server that can receive the packet.
Negotiate a data rate for transferring data responsive to the received packet to the determined blade server.
Transfer a portion of the received packet to the determined blade server via a common bus.
results: Enable efficient communication between multiple blade servers at varying data rates.
Improve the negotiation of data rates for transferring packets between servers.
openai_json.research_subject: Communication system and method using a multiserver platform

motivations: Existing multiserver platforms face challenges in efficiently communicating and transferring data between blade servers at varying data rates.
There is a need for improved packet routing and data rate negotiation mechanisms in multiserver environments to optimize performance.
objectives: Develop a system and method for efficient packet communication and data transfer between multiple blade servers in a multiserver platform.
Enable dynamic data rate negotiation and packet routing between blade servers to optimize communication performance.
methods: Implement packet receiving and routing mechanisms that determine appropriate destination blade servers for incoming packets.
Utilize data rate negotiation protocols to transfer data between blade servers at optimized speeds.
Employ a common bus architecture for transferring packet data between multiple blade servers.
results: Improved efficiency in data communication and packet transfer between blade servers in multiserver platforms.
Enhanced system performance through dynamic data rate negotiation and optimized packet routing.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Multiserver platform communication system with dynamic data rate negotiation
